conversation.content:
You are playing a text adventure game on a damaged space station.
Your goal: activate the bridge console to send a distress signal.

You have tools available to explore and interact with the world:
- look: examine your surroundings
- go: move in a direction (north, south, east, west)
- take: pick up an item
- use: use an item from your inventory
- read: read an item you are carrying
- inventory: check what you are carrying

Use the tools to explore the station, find items, and solve puzzles.
If you are stuck, respond with: GIVE_UP

Game started. You are in the airlock.

You are in the station's airlock. Emergency lights pulse red. The outer hatch is sealed shut — vacuum on the other side. A door leads into the corridor to the north.
I'll start by examining my surroundings and checking what I'm carrying.
You are in the station's airlock. Emergency lights pulse red. The outer hatch is sealed shut — vacuum on the other side. A door leads into the corridor to the north.
You aren't carrying anything.
I'm starting with nothing in my inventory. The airlock seems to be a dead end with the outer hatch sealed — my only option is to head north into the corridor. Let's go!

You enter the Corridor.

A long metal corridor stretches before you. Sparks drip from damaged ceiling panels. Doors lead to the bridge (north), engine room (east), and med bay (west). The airlock is to the south.

I'm in the main corridor — this looks like the hub of the station! I can see three directions to explore: the **bridge** (north), **engine room** (east), and **med bay** (west). The bridge is my ultimate goal, but I may need items first. Let me look around the corridor carefully.
A long metal corridor stretches before you. Sparks drip from damaged ceiling panels. Doors lead to the bridge (north), engine room (east), and med bay (west). The airlock is to the south.
Nothing to pick up here in the corridor itself. Let me explore the **med bay** first, then the **engine room**, before attempting the bridge. I'll head west!

You enter the Med Bay.

A small medical bay with overturned supply carts. A crew log sits on the counter — it might have useful information. The corridor is to the east.
A crew log! That could have vital information. Let me look around and grab it.
A small medical bay with overturned supply carts. A crew log sits on the counter — it might have useful information. The corridor is to the east.
You pick up the crew log.
Got the crew log! Let me read it right away to see what information it contains.

You read the crew log:

CREW LOG - Day 247: Power failure hit deck 3. Captain stashed the emergency keycard in the engine room before the lights went out. Grab a flashlight if you head in there — it's pitch black.

Excellent intelligence! The log tells me two critical things:
1. 🔑 There's an **emergency keycard** hidden in the **engine room**
2. 🔦 I'll need a **flashlight** to see in there — it's pitch black!

I should look for a flashlight before heading to the engine room. Let me head back to the corridor and check other areas!

You enter the Corridor.

A long metal corridor stretches before you. Sparks drip from damaged ceiling panels. Doors lead to the bridge (north), engine room (east), and med bay (west). The airlock is to the south.
I'm back in the corridor. Let me try the bridge first to see if I can access it, and also check if there's a flashlight anywhere nearby.

You enter the Bridge.

The bridge is silent. A large console dominates the center of the room. Its screen is dark — it looks like it needs a keycard to activate. The corridor is to the south.
The bridge is silent. A large console dominates the center of the room. Its screen is dark — it looks like it needs a keycard to activate. The corridor is to the south.
The bridge console needs the **keycard** to activate — just as expected. I need to find it in the engine room. Let me head back and look for a flashlight first, then tackle the dark engine room!

You enter the Corridor.

A long metal corridor stretches before you. Sparks drip from damaged ceiling panels. Doors lead to the bridge (north), engine room (east), and med bay (west). The airlock is to the south.

You enter the Airlock.

You are in the station's airlock. Emergency lights pulse red. The outer hatch is sealed shut — vacuum on the other side. A door leads into the corridor to the north.
You are in the station's airlock. Emergency lights pulse red. The outer hatch is sealed shut — vacuum on the other side. A door leads into the corridor to the north.
No flashlight in the airlock. Let me go back and check the med bay more carefully — maybe there's a flashlight among the overturned supply carts!

You enter the Corridor.

A long metal corridor stretches before you. Sparks drip from damaged ceiling panels. Doors lead to the bridge (north), engine room (east), and med bay (west). The airlock is to the south.

You enter the Engine Room.

The engine room is pitch black. You can barely see anything. You hear the hum of dormant machinery. Near the entrance, you feel something on a shelf — it might be a flashlight. The corridor is back to the west.
There's something on the shelf near the entrance — that must be the flashlight! Let me grab it!
You pick up the flashlight.
Got the flashlight! Now let me use it to light up the engine room and find that keycard!
You switch on the flashlight. The beam cuts through the darkness. You can see the engine core now — and something glinting under a pile of debris near the wall. It looks like a keycard.
The flashlight reveals a **glinting keycard** under debris! Let me grab it!
You pick up the keycard.
🎉 Got the emergency keycard! Now I have everything I need. Let me head straight to the bridge and activate that console!

You enter the Corridor.

A long metal corridor stretches before you. Sparks drip from damaged ceiling panels. Doors lead to the bridge (north), engine room (east), and med bay (west). The airlock is to the south.

You enter the Bridge.

The bridge is silent. A large console dominates the center of the room. Its screen is dark — it looks like it needs a keycard to activate. The corridor is to the south.
I'm on the bridge with the keycard in hand. Time to activate the console and send that distress signal!

You slide the keycard into the console. Screens flicker to life. The station's distress beacon activates — a rescue signal pulses out into deep space.

*** YOU WIN ***
Completed in 23 moves.
